title: FastAPI Fundamentals
description: Test your knowledge of FastAPI basics, routing, and core concepts.

questions.question: What is FastAPI primarily used for?
options: Creating modern, fast web APIs with automatic documentation
questions.correctAnswer: Creating modern, fast web APIs with automatic documentation
questions.explanation: FastAPI is a modern, fast web framework for building APIs with Python 3.7+ based on standard Python type hints.

questions.question: What makes FastAPI particularly fast compared to other Python web frameworks?
options: It has built-in async support and automatic request validation
It uses a different Python interpreter
questions.correctAnswer: It has built-in async support and automatic request validation
questions.explanation: FastAPI leverages Python's async/await syntax and provides automatic request validation using Pydantic models.

questions.question: How do you define a path parameter in FastAPI?
questions.explanation: Path parameters in FastAPI are defined using curly braces {} in the route decorator.

questions.question: How are query parameters handled in FastAPI?
options: They must be explicitly defined in the route decorator
They are automatically parsed and can be function parameters with defaults
They need to be manually extracted from the request object
They are only available in POST requests
questions.correctAnswer: They are automatically parsed and can be function parameters with defaults
questions.explanation: FastAPI automatically parses query parameters and allows them as function parameters with optional default values.

questions.question: What is the role of Pydantic models in FastAPI?
options: To validate and serialize request/response data
questions.correctAnswer: To validate and serialize request/response data
questions.explanation: Pydantic models in FastAPI are used for automatic request validation, response serialization, and generating OpenAPI documentation.

questions.question: What kind of automatic documentation does FastAPI generate?
options: Interactive API documentation with Swagger UI and ReDoc
questions.correctAnswer: Interactive API documentation with Swagger UI and ReDoc
questions.explanation: FastAPI automatically generates interactive API documentation accessible at /docs (Swagger UI) and /redoc (ReDoc) endpoints.

questions.question: How do you specify a response model in FastAPI?
options: Using the response_model parameter in the route decorator
By returning a Pydantic model directly
questions.explanation: FastAPI supports multiple ways to specify response models: using response_model parameter, returning Pydantic models directly, or using decorators.

questions.question: What is dependency injection in FastAPI?
options: A way to inject CSS into HTML responses
A design pattern for managing code dependencies and reusable components
A method for database connection management
questions.correctAnswer: A design pattern for managing code dependencies and reusable components
questions.explanation: Dependency injection in FastAPI allows you to declare dependencies (like database connections, authentication) that are automatically resolved and injected into your route functions.

title: Advanced FastAPI Features
description: Explore advanced FastAPI concepts including security, middleware, and testing.

questions.question: What authentication method does FastAPI commonly use for securing APIs?
questions.explanation: FastAPI has excellent support for OAuth2 with JWT (JSON Web Tokens) for secure API authentication.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of middleware in FastAPI?
options: To process requests and responses globally before they reach route handlers
questions.correctAnswer: To process requests and responses globally before they reach route handlers
questions.explanation: Middleware in FastAPI intercepts and processes all requests and responses, useful for CORS, logging, authentication checks, etc.

questions.question: How does FastAPI handle Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS)?
options: By manually setting headers in each response
CORS is automatically enabled for all origins
questions.explanation: FastAPI provides CORSMiddleware that can be easily configured to handle CORS headers for cross-origin requests.

questions.question: Does FastAPI support WebSocket connections?
options: Yes, with WebSocket endpoints similar to HTTP routes
WebSockets are deprecated in modern APIs
questions.correctAnswer: Yes, with WebSocket endpoints similar to HTTP routes
questions.explanation: FastAPI supports WebSocket connections with a similar syntax to HTTP routes, allowing real-time bidirectional communication.

questions.question: What are background tasks used for in FastAPI?
options: Running tasks in the background without blocking the response
questions.explanation: Background tasks in FastAPI allow you to run operations after returning a response, useful for email sending, cleanup, or any non-blocking operations.

questions.question: What testing framework is commonly used with FastAPI?
questions.explanation: FastAPI provides a TestClient based on HTTPX that works with pytest for comprehensive API testing.
